column2: OKLAHOMA PERMIT TEST
Question Text
1. To keep the driver behind you at a safe distance you should:
column4: drive 5 MPH faster than the car behind.
column6: drive 5 MPH slower than the car behind.

column2: 2. The sign in the picture:
column4: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column6: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column8: means that you need to stop.
column10: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
4. The driver of an emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can legally:
5. When driving at night, drivers should:
column8: look directly into the oncoming headlights of approaching vehicles.

column2: 6. Which of the following is a common cause of a traffic collisions?
7. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column6: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 8. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column6: turn left into the one-way road.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column10: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.

column2: 9. A broken yellow line to the right of a solid yellow center line means:
column6: you are only allowed to make left turns in this area.
column8: you may pass other vehicles if no oncoming traffic is present.

column2: 10. Excessive speed:
column4: increases the likelihood of serious bodily injuries and death.
column6: helps you to maneuver around obstacles.
column8: saves time so you can get to your destination more quickly.

column2: 11. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must not make a right turn.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.

column2: 12. BAC is expressed in:
column10: ounces of alcohol in your blood.

column2: 13. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
14. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: take longer than cars to stop.
column6: require more space for turning movements.
column8: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column10: are easier for the driver to operate.

column2: 15. Increasing your vehicle’s speed _____ your field of vision.
16. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column8: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column2: 17. Drivers may pass on a two-lane roadway marked with a single solid yellow line on their side of the center line.
18. This sign means:
column6: The road will curve to the right.
column8: Left turns are not allowed at the intersection.

column2: 19. Drivers must yield to pedestrians:
column4: only if the pedestrian is in a crosswalk.
column6: if the pedestrian signals to the driver that the driver must stop.
column8: even when the pedestrian crosses the street without looking both ways.
column10: only if the pedestrian is on the same side of the road.

column2: 20. This road sign is:
21. This road sign means:
column10: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 22. Gauging the speed of a motorcycle may be difficult because:
column6: many motorcyclists do not activate the brake light.
column8: motorcycles take up less of your field of vision.
column10: motorcycles often slow down by downshifting.

column2: 23. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column6: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 24. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column4: wait until the red lights stop flashing.
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 25. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: that a tire blowout is about to occur.
